Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer breached procedural fairness or acted unreasonably in rejecting the application
Governing_Law: Subsection 76(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Application_Facts: Applicant scored 70 points but was rejected due to concerns about English proficiency, lack of PhD, and limited international experience; she argued she could adapt and improve post-arrival
Decision_Outcome: Rejection of immigration application based on substituted evaluation
Court_Ruling: Decision quashed and case returned for reconsideration by a different officer
Defendant_Behavior: Officer applied substituted evaluation and required immediate economic self-sufficiency
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable decision, failure to consider brother's support during transition
Assessment_Factor: English proficiency, possession of PhD, international experience, economic self-sufficiency
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, Subsection 76(3)
Evidence_Used: Applicant's education, work experience, language skills, family support offer
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 76(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Evidence_Assessed: Applicant's potential for economic establishment in Canada
Governing_Rule: Subsection 76(3) allows officers to substitute evaluation if points do not reflect economic potential
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider non-economic support (brother's offer) in assessing adaptability
Outcome: Decision set aside, remitted for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of immigration opportunity due to unreasonable interpretation
Cause_Description: Rejection under substituted evaluation for perceived inability to economically establish in Canada
Evidence_Handling: Officer did not adequately consider evidence of transitional support
Legal_Provision_Violated: Principles of procedural fairness under administrative law
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient consideration of soft factors such as family support and adaptability
Legal_Provision: Subsection 76(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Evidence_Assessment: Officer focused narrowly on immediate economic self-sufficiency
Decision_Rationale: Assumed need for immediate economic self-sufficiency, disregarding transitional support
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of holistic assessment of applicantâ€™s integration potential
